thread.title: Man driving stolen SUV shot by police in Walgreens parking lot, GBI says – WSB-TV Channel 2 - Atlanta
thread.title_full: Man driving stolen SUV shot by police in Walgreens parking lot, GBI says – WSB-TV Channel 2 - Atlanta

author: Michael Seiden
title: Man driving stolen SUV shot by police in Walgreens parking lot, GBI says – WSB-TV Channel 2 - Atlanta
text: CHAMBLEE, Ga. — The Georgia Bureau of Investigation is investigating [after an officer-involved shooting in Chamblee](https://www.wsbtv.com/news/local/dekalb-county/officer-involved-shooting-investigation-underway-near-dekalb-county-walgreens-police-say/NJUMU6ATARHJ5G443ZKUNBJTJE/) on Thursday morning. Investigators said officers pulled over a suspected stolen SUV around 7:45 a.m. in a Walgreens parking lot in the 5300 block of Peachtree Boulevard. At some point during the stop, an officer fired his gun and the driver was hit. “There was more than one shot fired. As far as the number of times the person was that has not been determined by any of here,” Chamblee Police Chief Michael Dieppa said. [DOWNLOAD: [Free WSB-TV News app for alerts as news breaks](https://www.wsbtv.com/smart-tv/)] Investigators have not said what led up to the shooting. It’s also unclear if the driver was armed or if he fired any shots at officers. Thursday afternoon, the [GBI identified the suspect as Jeremiah Quincy Kinard](https://gbi.georgia.gov/press-releases/2023-12-28/gbi-investigates-officer-involved-shooting-chamblee-ga), 24 of Auburn, Ga. He’s still receiving medical treatment, according to the GBI. No officers were injured. TRENDING STORIES: [Atlanta man can only be taken off life support with this legal document, family says](https://www.wsbtv.com/news/local/atlanta/atlanta-man-can-only-be-taken-off-life-support-with-this-legal-document-family-says/WWQAZQKDPZE7NKAOXGFIX4GCEM/) [19-year-old arrested for shooting, killing woman inside Atlanta McDonald’s, police say](https://www.wsbtv.com/news/local/atlanta/19-year-old-arrested-shooting-killing-woman-inside-atlanta-mcdonalds-police-say/64CFUV2EXVFNJB5Q5OF2QF4JTU/) [Here’s why Georgia officials say there’s a “severe” SNAP delay across the state](https://www.wsbtv.com/news/local/atlanta/heres-why-georgia-officials-say-theres-severe-snap-delay-across-state/CMLW43IGBVHURJSQ6IVMELF6BA/) Neighbors who live adjacent to the shooting scene told Channel 2 Action News that they were surprised to see crime tape near their homes. “It looks pretty crazy,” Danielle Fletcher, a dental hygienist who lives down the street from the Walgreens, said. “There’s an officer that lives in my building, so I just kind of came down to look at the cars to make sure none of them were him.” Thursday’s incident marked the 103rd officer-involved shooting of 2023, according to GBI. Last year, GBI responded to 112. [SIGN UP: [WSB-TV Daily Headlines Newsletter](https://membercenter.wsbtv.com/newsletters)] IN OTHER NEWS: ©2023 Cox Media Group
